NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Art and Diversity or the cell corresponding to Art and Globalization?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Art} and {Globalization} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Social Media and Commercialization or the cell corresponding to Social Media and Localization?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Social Media} and {Localization} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Literature and Critique or the cell corresponding to TV Shows and Diversity?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Literature} and {Critique} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Music and Innovation or the cell corresponding to Literature and Preservation?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Literature} and {Preservation} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.74 to 0.94?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Travel, Accessibility), (Art, Adoption), (Literature, Adoption), (Music, Adoption), (TV Shows, Adoption), (Art, Commercialization), (Gaming, Commercialization), (Music, Commercialization), (Cuisine, Critique), (TV Shows, Critique), (Art, Globalization), (Music, Influence), (Travel, Innovation), (Cuisine, Localization), (Movies, Localization), (TV Shows, Localization), (Literature, Preservation), (Travel, Preservation)}.
